name: Roles in Cassandra.txt - List All Roles
description: This section explains how to list all the roles that have been created in a Cassandra database. It provides a command that can be used to retrieve a list of all the roles defined in the system. This command is useful for administrators or users who need to view and manage the roles assigned to different users or groups within the Cassandra environment.
use_cases: Viewing all roles defined in the Cassandra system

name: Roles in Cassandra.txt - Get privileges
description: This section explains how to create a new role in Cassandra with specific privileges. It provides a command to create a role named 'sys_admin' with a password 'IcanDoIt4ll'. The role is granted login access but not superuser privileges, which is recommended for most practical use cases to maintain a secure system.
use_cases: Creating a new role with login access
Assigning a password to a role
Granting limited privileges to a role (non-superuser)

name: Roles in Cassandra.txt - Add a role
description: This section explains how to grant privileges to roles in Cassandra, a popular distributed database management system. It describes two ways to grant privileges: either directly granting specific permissions like 'select' to a role, or creating a common role with read access and assigning that role to other roles. The example provided shows how to grant the 'select' permission on the 'kong' keyspace to the 'redash' role.
use_cases: Granting specific permissions (e.g., select) to a role
Creating a common role with read access and assigning it to other roles
Managing access control and permissions for different roles
